definitions.definition: A poem describing the life and manners of shepherds; a poem in which the speakers assume the character of shepherds; an idyll; a bucolic.
A cantata relating to rural life; a composition for instruments characterized by simplicity and sweetness; a lyrical composition the subject of which is taken from rural life.
A letter of a pastor to his charge; specifically, a letter addressed by a bishop to his diocese.
A letter of the House of Bishops , to be read in each parish.

main_definition: A poem describing the life and manners of shepherds; a poem in which the speakers assume the character of shepherds; an idyll; a bucolic.
secondary_definitions: ( music ) A cantata relating to rural life; a composition for instruments characterized by simplicity and sweetness; a lyrical composition the subject of which is taken from rural life.
( religion , Christianity ) A letter of a pastor to his charge; specifically, a letter addressed by a bishop to his diocese.
( religion , Christianity ) A letter of the House of Bishops , to be read in each parish.
